SENT.plain: Acromesomelic dwarfism is a distinct condition characterized by short stature of the short limb type, with the hands and feet showing the most obvious deviations from normal
The forearm bones are usually disproportionately shorter than the other long tubular bones of the limbs
Available data suggest autosomal recessive transmission
Characteristic clinical and radiographic features permit establishment of a confident diagnosis in the first year of life
